title: Henriques (Jordão Mauricio)
body:
He is the son of António Maria Henriques, attended the lyceum and the Higher School of Letters, and was born in Funchal on October 15, 1880. He was a clerk interpreter at the Health Station and a teacher at the Higher Primary School, also serving as an interim teacher at the Lyceum. He was an editor of the former Diário Popular and had a wide and valuable collaboration in other Madeiran newspapers, with his writings standing out for their refined literary style.

In 1922, he published a book entitled _Da Pátria e da Escola_. Having pursued a diplomatic career, he served for several years in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and is currently the Consul General of Portugal in the city of Rio de Janeiro.

Funchal: Birthplace of Jordão Mauricio Henriques and where he held various professional positions.
Rio de Janeiro: Location where Jordão Mauricio Henriques is the Consul General of Portugal.

1922: Publication of the book _Da Pátria e da Escola_ by Jordão Mauricio Henriques.
